intro: Theligonum alsinoideum, commonly known as the American hogweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along riverbanks and wetlands. Theligonum alsinoideum is also known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation.
